metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7941 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SelectionOwner::ProcessTarget function in ui/base/x/selection_owner.cc in the UI implementation in Google Chrome before 40.0.2214.91 uses an incorrect data type for a certain length value, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via crafted X11 data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7941` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-browser-l10n - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-chromedriver - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> The code is not used in Oxide

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0.2214.94-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1068').
